abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Power Sector Development
            Project for Africa were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: It is difficult to foresee and calculate
            the impact of externalities such as political risk, thus
            appropriate mitigating measures should be identified. Sector
            reforms should be pursued in parallel with investments.
            Institutional arrangements should involve few entities if
            possible. Thorough assessment of fiduciary and safeguard
            capacity of coordinating/implementing structures is
            necessary during project preparation and appropriate
            mitigation measures implemented to avoid implementation
            delays. Realistic estimation of components’ costs at
            preparation. Simplicity and clarity in project design.
            Financial covenants should be realistic relative to the
            client’s capacity.
